name: Citigroup
title: AI-Driven Middle Office Automation (-20K Headcount)

classification.classificationRationale: Tentative Model 6a (Enterprise-Wide Adoption). Citigroup CFO expects -20K headcount via AI automation of middle-office and operational functions. No CAIO, no dedicated AI lab, no AI CoE described — AI is being deployed broadly across existing functions. Contextual: AI automates within existing roles. Low confidence reflects single source with minimal organizational detail.

description:
Citigroup CFO Mark Mason expects headcount to be down by approximately 20,000 as part of a broad organizational overhaul. Automation and AI-enabled systems will allow middle-office and operational functions to run with fewer employees.

This is part of a broader financial services AI restructuring wave: UBS (first CAIO), Wells Fargo (Head of AI), JPMorgan (AI CoE), Commonwealth Bank (first CAIO). Citigroup's approach appears to be enterprise-wide automation rather than dedicated AI organizational structure.

Citigroup's approach (automate middle office) is different from UBS (appoint CAIO) or JPMorgan (build CoE). Same sector, different organizational responses to AI.
